intro: Hieracium lachenalii subsp. acutatifrons, commonly known as the acute-fronded hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate, hairy leaves and produces yellow ray florets surrounded by tubular disc florets. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils in mountainous regions of Europe. It has a low-growing habit with flowering stems that bear a single, composite flower head. This subspecies is distinguished by its acute, sharply pointed leaf tips and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats.
